solution_line_template: Donna got ${original_price} x {discount_percentage} = $<<{original_price}*{discount_percentage}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount} less for the porcelain vase.
So, the porcelain vase is now ${original_price} - ${discount_amount} = $<<{original_price}-{discount_amount}={sale_price}>>{sale_price}.
Donna has to pay ${sale_price} x {sales_tax_percentage} = $<<{sale_price}*{sales_tax_percentage}={sales_tax_amount}>>{sales_tax_amount} for the sales tax.
